DOCNAME: CASE OF ŠVARC AND KAVNIK v. SLOVENIA
CONCLUSION: Violations of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . PERSON was born in DATE and lives in GPE . PERSON was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were injured in a car accident in GPE . The accident resulted in the premature birth of their son , who sustained in utero injuries in the accident . The son died in hospital in GPE ( GPE ) on DATE . The perpetrator of the accident had taken out insurance with the insurance company Wiener ORG PERSON ( “ WA ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings against GPE in the then ORG , Velenje Branch ( PERSON sodišče v PERSON , ORG ) , seeking damages of CARDINAL NORP tolars for the injuries sustained in the car accident and the non - pecuniary damage sustained following the death of their son .

On DATE Mr PERSON , a professor at ORG GPE , delivered an expert opinion in the case at the request of GPE . He stated that the NORP courts had no jurisdiction to examine the applicants ' claims . At the time , PERSON was a work colleague of PERSON .

On DATE WA lodged preliminary written submissions arguing that the case was not within the court 's jurisdiction . They attached the opinion prepared by PERSON to the submissions , which were included in the file and served on the applicants .
On DATE Mr PERSON was appointed as a justice at ORG ( PERSON sodišče ) .
On DATE ORG , Velenje Branch , held a hearing .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicants lodged preliminary written submissions contesting PERSON opinion and GPE 's arguments .

On DATE a decision dated CARDINAL DATE , the date on which the hearing was held , was served on the applicants . The court decided that the case was not within its jurisdiction , but made no explicit reference to PERSON PERSON 's opinion .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicants lodged an appeal with ORG ( PERSON sodišče v PERSON ) .
On DATE the Convention took effect with respect to GPE .
On DATE , on a request by ORG , the first - instance court delivered a supplementary decision concerning the costs of the proceedings .
On DATE the applicants appealed against the decision concerning costs .
On DATE ORG dismissed both applicants ' appeals .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG sodišče ) against the decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal on points of law against the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and rejected the appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE as inadmissible .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a constitutional appeal with ORG ( PERSON sodišče ) . In their appeal , they made no reference to PERSON opinion .
On DATE PERSON was appointed as a justice at ORG .

On DATE ORG declared the appeal inadmissible as manifestly ill - founded . PERSON was the president of the CARDINAL - judge bench which examined the admissibility of the case and PERSON ORG was also a member of that bench . The applicants learned of the composition of the panel on DATE , the date on which the decision was served on them .
CARDINAL . The relevant provision of LAW ( PERSON ) reads as follows :

“ Everyone has the right to have any decision regarding his or her rights , obligations and any charges brought against him or her made without undue delay by an independent , impartial court constituted by law .
Only a judge appointed pursuant to rules pre - established by law and in accordance with normal judicial practices shall try such a person . ”
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o ustavnem sodišču ) read as follows :
“ In deciding on a particular case , ORG may disqualify a judge of ORG by applying , mutatis mutandis , the applicable reasons for disqualification in court proceedings .
The following shall not serve as reasons for disqualification from the proceedings :
- participation in legislative procedures or in adoption of other general acts ( including those issued for exercise of public powers ) that have been challenged prior to election as a judge of ORG ,
- expressing a scientific opinion on a legal matter which may be relevant for the proceedings . ”

“ Immediately after a judge of ORG learns of any reasons for his or her disqualification in accordance with the preceding section , he or she must cease ... work on the case and notify the president of ORG . ”

“ A request for disqualification may be submitted by the parties to the proceedings up until the start of a public hearing , if such hearing is due to be held , or until DATE in camera session of ORG at which the matter is to be decided . The request must be substantiated .

The judge of ORG whose disqualification is sought shall have the right to comment on the statements in the request , but may not participate in the decision on his or her disqualification . The Constitutional Court shall decide in camera upon the disqualification of a judge . If the number of votes for and against is equal , the president shall have the casting vote . ”

“ Anyone who believes that his or her human rights and basic freedoms have been infringed by a particular act of a state body , local body or statutory authority may lodge a constitutional appeal with ORG , subject to compliance with the conditions laid down by LAW . ... ”
“ A constitutional appeal may be lodged only after all legal remedies have been exhausted .

Before all special legal remedies have been exhausted , ORG may exceptionally hear a constitutional appeal if a violation is probable and the appellant will suffer irreparable consequences as a result of a particular act . ”
“ A decision on whether to accept a constitutional complaint and begin proceedings shall be taken by ORG , sitting in a CARDINAL - judge bench , at an in camera session ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o pravdnem postopku ) read as follows :
“ A judge or a lay judge shall be prohibited from exercising judicial functions :
( CARDINAL ) if he or she is a party to the civil proceedings , is a representative or an advocate of a party ... or was heard as a witness or an expert in the same proceedings ...
( CARDINAL ) if he or she participated in the same proceedings before a lower court ...
( CARDINAL ) if other circumstances raise doubt about his or her impartiality . ”
“ The parties to the proceedings may also seek the disqualification of a judge .

A party must seek the disqualification of a judge or a lay judge as soon as he or she learns of the reason for disqualification , but no later than by the end of the hearing in the competent court or , when no hearing was held , by the time the decision is rendered .
In the disqualification request , the party must state the circumstances on which his or her request for disqualification is based . ”

“ As soon as a judge or a lay judge learns of the request for his or her disqualification , he or she must cease any activity in the proceedings concerned ; if the challenged is lodged under point CARDINAL of section DATE , he or she may continue examination of the case .

If a judge is disqualified in accordance with point CARDINAL of section QUANTITY , the procedural activities he or she performed after the request for disqualification was lodged shall have no legal effect . ”
